factorization

Class Band

  • java.lang.Object
    • factorization.Band

  • public class Band
extends Object
    Contains methods that are useful for handling band conditions.
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis

    • Method Detail

      • band_grouping

        public static List<org.javatuples.Triplet<Join_Predicate,List<DP_State_Node>,List<DP_State_Node>>> band_grouping(List<DP_State_Node> left,
                                                                                                                 List<DP_State_Node> right,
                                                                                                                 Join_Predicate band)
        Given two DP stages that correspond to the tuples of two relations and a band condition, translates the band into multiple inequalities that give the same result. The resulting inequalities cover different (and possibly overlapping) groups of left-right tuples. These can then be handled independently. The two relations are assumed to be already sorted.
        Parameters:
        left - The first (sorted) relation/stage as a list of DP state-nodes.
        right - The second (sorted) relation/stage as a list of DP state-nodes.
        band - A band join predicate between the two relations.
        Returns:
        A list of (inequality, left', right') triples where the inequality predicate covers left'-right' tuples

      • split_by_epsilon

        public static List<List<DP_State_Node>> split_by_epsilon(List<DP_State_Node> stage,
                                                         int attr_idx,
                                                         double epsilon)
        Splits the tuples of a DP stage that corresponds to the tuples of a relations into groups according to an attribute of a band condition and its epsilon. The tuples have to be sorted beforehand. The resulting partitions satisy the following:
        • Each partition contains a range of values bounded by epsilon (inclusive).
        • Each partition contains the maximum number of tuples possible.
        • The partitions are sorted both locally and globally.
        The resulting list doesn't allocate new lists of nodes. Instead, views of the original list as sublists are used.
        Parameters:
        stage - The (sorted) subset of a relation/stage.
        attr_idx - The index of the attribute we use for spliiting.
        epsilon - The epsilon parameter of a band predicate.
        Returns:
        List> A partitioning of the nodes as a list of lists.
